text: Call upon the Minotaurs to fight for you.

The Dread King's name was derived from a powerful aura that surrounded him at all times, only the mightiest of beings could face him without physically shaking or panicking, most would be frozen in fear or outright flee.
Dread Aura
Minotaur Summoner
The Black Grail Knights were the resurrected corpses of twelve long dead Grail Knights of Bretonnia.
Summon Black Grail Kinghts
An ancient scourge of the living has been unleashed and only the mindless can escape the creeping feeling of desperation and horror caused by the Hand of Nagash.
Ancient Horror
To be honest it is mostly executioner. Everyone who stands against Nagash is guilty by default.
Jury, Judge and Executioner
Focussing the winds of death around him, the Hand of Nagash can unleash a devastating wave of destruction.
Call of Death

The Hand of Nagash has strapped the torso of a most hated foe to his halberd. Though the name of this unlucky person is lost to time, it is said that the terror and pain of his last moments still radiates from his tortured remains.
The Punished One
When the Hand of Nagash fades, the forbidden runes of this Blade activate, using the life of his enemies to preserve his unholy existence.
The Hungering Blade
The disciples of Nagash spread his influence wherever they go. And where the power of Nagash is on the rise, the dead won't find rest easily.
Cursed Lands
Buried under the sands, countless forgotten legions wait for Nagash to call them to arms once again.
Call the Legions

The towering frame of a skeletal giant can be seen far and wide on the battlefield. As such they are perfectly suited to serve as a conduit to channel the dark magic from the necromancer to his troops, anchoring them in the mortal world.
Necromantic Anchor
Lingering Essence
Larenscheld resurrected the Dread King in exchange for immortality - and he received it, in a way. However, it came in a different form than he expected.
Skull Bombardment
Larenscheld has been granted the ability to call forth vengeful spirits in the shape of skulls from the realms beyond the mortal veil to torment the living.
Wraith Liche
Even if the body perishes, his mind and magic will persist to haunt those who bested him.
Discard Body
The mortal body is but a shell that holds back true greatness and may be discarded at will.
Just give the order and the Hydra's heads will spew forth their pestilent breath, each competing for the most noxious fumes.
Pestilential Breath
The twisted power of the Black Grail protects these dark creatures from any harm.
The Blessing of the Black Grail
A solid pikeline attacked on the front is virtually unassailable, and it quickly tranforms in a spiky caterpillar of death.
Push of Pikes
Unit forms into a diamond shape for immense penetration when charging, but very slow movement speed.
Diamond
The twisted power of the Black Grail protects these dark creatures from any harm.
The Blessing of the Black Grail
By the might of Nagash and the power of the Dread King, a cohort of deadly Skeletal MInotaurs is summoned to assist your legions!
Realm of Souls Skeletal Minotaurs Trigger
By the might of Nagash and the power of the Dread King, a cohort of deadly Skeletal MInotaurs is summoned to assist your legions!
Realm of Souls Skeletal Minotaurs
Phalanx
With shields locked together, the ranks of this formation are nigh unbreakable.
Unending Legions
Quantity over quality is a very viable tactic for the Legion of Terror. For every skeleton slain, another will be raised.
Unnerving Presence
These undead permeate an aura of constant dread, not unlike their leader, although at a much weaker level.
Impenetrable Phalanx
In life the Legions were famous for their impenetrable spear and pike formations. In death, their defence has become even more stalwart.
Preserved Ferocity
A small spark of the original creature is preserved in this animated corpse. In midst of battle, this spark may be ignited in a viscious fury against the enemy.
Undead Elite
Wights are superior fighters compared to regular skeletons and freed from the confines of the living, many became even more fearsome.
Undead Discipline
The dead fear nothing, they will never flee and always maintain perfect formation. No army of the living can match their discipline and obedience.
Unholy Warmachines
Legion Chariots have been reinforced with unholy magic, making them even more deadly on the battlefield.
Death Knights
The mounted forces of the Legion are often used to counter the mobile units of the enemy and are well prepared for that task.
Soul Siphoners
The terrifying spectres risen by the Dread King are able to siphon off energy of the very soul of their enemies, using it to protect themselves from all harm.
Infectious Rage
The untempered rage of the more feral elements of the army can spread to nearby allies, causing them to fight with greater savagery.
Miasma of Death
The large amounts of Shyish needed to animate these monstrous undead will further grow through nearby deaths on the battlefield, increasingly sapping the strength from the enemies in the vicinity.
With each blow, the blade drains the opponent's life force and strengthens that of its wielder.
Soulreaper
With ancient knowledge in hand, the Winds of Magic themselves present little challenge.
Grimoire Necris
The unholy power of the Dread King suppresses the magical abilities of all nearby enemies.
Heart of Blackness
The unholy oaths they swore protect them from harm as long as they obey them and defend their lord.
Dark Oaths
Should their comrades fall, the others will fight even harder to avenge them.
Soul Avenger
After the ancient axe blades have harvested enough souls, the dark magic within them comes to life.
Wight Blade
Even in death, the Kleruchoi remember they mustn’t fail their overlord.
Unyielding
Magic Suppression
Sheer hatred towards the magic which binds the apparition to the world of the living is manifested in a magic suppressing aura, turning enchanted blades into ordinary weapons.
Unnerving Presence
This vengeful ghost permeates an aura of constant dread, not unlike their leader, although at a much weaker level.
Overdrive
When required the spirit will push its puppet far beyond its physical limitations. Performing at that level will continue to harm the corpse which only seems to amuse its puppeteer.
